p: Prostaglandin E 2 (PGE 2) is a bioactive lipid that physiologically mediates the regulation of immune responses, blood pressure, gastrointestinal integrity, and fertility. However, the sequential actions of cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2) catalyze PGE 2 synthesis. Consequently, dysregulated PGE 2 production has been correlated to a variety of pathological conditions, such as chronic inflammation ( Legler et al., 2010). Inhibition of COX-2 expression in mice model was exerted by G. procumbens essential oil and its active ingredients. Both G. procumbens essential oil and its active ingredients were showing similar COX-2 inhibitory effects as that of the positive control drug diclofenac diethylamine emulgel ( Huang et al., 2019). The use of the G. bicolor extract inhibited PGE 2 production and COX-2 protein expression and activity in activated macrophages ( Wu et al., 2013) and endothelial cells ( Chao et al., 2015). PGE 2 production was also inhibited using the extract of G. pseudochina var. hispida with an IC 50 value of 25.23 μg/ml ( Siriwatanametanon et al., 2010).
